text:
In this unit, we are exploring ratios and how they are used to solve problems. At the end of this investigation, ask yourself:

What do you understand about ratios and reasoning with ratios?

Students answers might include discussions of the following:

  • Numbers are composed of factors.
  • Factors can be expresses using variables.
  • Multiples can be expresses using variables.
  • Expressions are mathematical objects that communicate thinking.
  • Patterns with numbers can be expresses with words, numbers, letters, or diagrams/pictures.
  • Numbers have varying amounts of factors. Some numbers have many factors, ad other have only two factors.

Students may review vocabulary: factors, multiple, square number, prime, composite, even, odd, sum, product, terms.

Students may relate ideas to area models or diagrams.
